# sistema-kardex Development Guidelines

Auto-generated from all feature plans. Last updated: 2026-01-04

## Active Technologies
- TypeScript 5.x + Next.js 16.1.1 (App Router), React 19.2.3, Tailwind CSS 4, (001-kardex-inventory)
- PostgreSQL (primary), MinIO (product images) (001-kardex-inventory)
- PostgreSQL (primary), MinIO (imagenes) (001-panel-pages-navbar)
- TypeScript 5.x + Next.js 16.1.1 (App Router), React 19.2.3, better-auth 1.4.10, Drizzle ORM, Tailwind CSS 4 (001-better-auth-login)
- PostgreSQL (primary), MinIO (assets) (001-better-auth-login)

- TypeScript 5.x + Next.js 16.1.1, React 19.2.3, Tailwind CSS 4 (001-kardex-inventario)

## Project Structure

```text
backend/
frontend/
tests/
```

## Commands

npm test; npm run lint

## Code Style

TypeScript 5.x: Follow standard conventions

## Recent Changes
- 001-better-auth-login: Added TypeScript 5.x + Next.js 16.1.1 (App Router), React 19.2.3, better-auth 1.4.10, Drizzle ORM, Tailwind CSS 4
- 001-panel-pages-navbar: Added TypeScript 5.x + Next.js 16.1.1, React 19.2.3, Tailwind CSS 4
- 001-kardex-inventory: Added TypeScript 5.x + Next.js 16.1.1 (App Router), React 19.2.3, Tailwind CSS 4,


<!-- MANUAL ADDITIONS START -->
<!-- MANUAL ADDITIONS END -->


## Skills
These skills are discovered at startup from multiple local sources. Each entry includes a name, description, and file path so you can open the source for full instructions.
- skill-creator: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Codex's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations. (file: C:/Users/ginol/Desktop/projects/sistema-kardex/.codex/skills/.system/skill-creator/SKILL.md)
- skill-installer: Install Codex skills into $CODEX_HOME/skills from a curated list or a GitHub repo path. Use when a user asks to list installable skills, install a curated skill, or install a skill from another repo (including private repos). (file: C:/Users/ginol/Desktop/projects/sistema-kardex/.codex/skills/.system/skill-installer/SKILL.md)
- Discovery: Available skills are listed in project docs and may also appear in a runtime "## Skills" section (name + description + file path). These are the sources of truth; skill bodies live on disk at the listed paths.
- Trigger rules: If the user names a skill (with `$SkillName` or plain text) OR the task clearly matches a skill's description, you must use that skill for that turn. Multiple mentions mean use them all. Do not carry skills across turns unless re-mentioned.
- Missing/blocked: If a named skill isn't in the list or the path can't be read, say so briefly and continue with the best fallback.
- How to use a skill (progressive disclosure):
  1) After deciding to use a skill, open its `SKILL.md`. Read only enough to follow the workflow.
  2) If `SKILL.md` points to extra folders such as `references/`, load only the specific files needed for the request; don't bulk-load everything.
  3) If `scripts/` exist, prefer running or patching them instead of retyping large code blocks.
  4) If `assets/` or templates exist, reuse them instead of recreating from scratch.
- Description as trigger: The YAML `description` in `SKILL.md` is the primary trigger signal; rely on it to decide applicability. If unsure, ask a brief clarification before proceeding.
- Coordination and sequencing:
  - If multiple skills apply, choose the minimal set that covers the request and state the order you'll use them.
  - Announce which skill(s) you're using and why (one short line). If you skip an obvious skill, say why.
- Context hygiene:
  - Keep context small: summarize long sections instead of pasting them; only load extra files when needed.
  - Avoid deeply nested references; prefer one-hop files explicitly linked from `SKILL.md`.
  - When variants exist (frameworks, providers, domains), pick only the relevant reference file(s) and note that choice.
- Safety and fallback: If a skill can't be applied cleanly (missing files, unclear instructions), state the issue, pick the next-best approach, and continue.

payload.message:
Agregue `RESEND_FROM` al `.env` porque `src/lib/actions/email.ts` lo requiere para enviar correos. El proyecto ya tenia el cliente de Resend y el envio de reset password.

No pude acceder a la documentacion via MCP: el servidor `Resend` en `.vscode/mcp.json` no expone recursos ni plantillas (listado vacio). Si quieres, puedo reintentar cuando el MCP este funcionando o seguir con docs externas.

Cambios
- `c:\Users\ginol\Desktop\projects\sistema-kardex\.env` agrega `RESEND_FROM=Kardex <no-reply@yourdomain.com>` (ajustalo a un remitente verificado en Resend).

Siguientes pasos opcionales
1. Dime el remitente real y lo ajusto en `.env`.
2. Si quieres, valido envio con un endpoint/accion de prueba.

content.text:
Agregue `RESEND_FROM` al `.env` porque `src/lib/actions/email.ts` lo requiere para enviar correos. El proyecto ya tenia el cliente de Resend y el envio de reset password.

No pude acceder a la documentacion via MCP: el servidor `Resend` en `.vscode/mcp.json` no expone recursos ni plantillas (listado vacio). Si quieres, puedo reintentar cuando el MCP este funcionando o seguir con docs externas.

Cambios

Siguientes pasos opcionales
1. Dime el remitente real y lo ajusto en `.env`.
2. Si quieres, valido envio con un endpoint/accion de prueba.

payload.name: apply_patch

payload.output: {"output":"Success. Updated the following files:\nM src/lib/actions/email.ts\n","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

payload.message:
La causa es que `resend.emails.send` exige una union (html/text/react/template) y TS no acepta `html`/`text` como `string | undefined`. Ajuste la construccion del payload para incluir solo campos definidos y agregue un guard si no hay contenido.

Cambios
- `src/lib/actions/email.ts` ahora construye `payload` tipado como `CreateEmailOptions`, omite `html/text` undefined y valida que exista al menos uno.

Siguientes pasos opcionales
1. Si quieres aceptar tambien `react` o `template`, amplio el input y el payload.

content.text:
La causa es que `resend.emails.send` exige una union (html/text/react/template) y TS no acepta `html`/`text` como `string | undefined`. Ajuste la construccion del payload para incluir solo campos definidos y agregue un guard si no hay contenido.

Cambios
- `src/lib/actions/email.ts` ahora construye `payload` tipado como `CreateEmailOptions`, omite `html/text` undefined y valida que exista al menos uno.

Siguientes pasos opcionales
1. Si quieres aceptar tambien `react` o `template`, amplio el input y el payload.

payload.text:
**Handling conditional payload typing**

I'm working through how to properly type an email payload that requires either html or text content. The challenge is narrowing the union type correctly so TypeScript accepts the conditional branches without errors. I'm planning to add explicit runtime checks and use `satisfies` to ensure the payload matches the expected email options, throwing if neither html nor text is provided. This way, I can keep the input type flexible while preventing type errors during payload construction.

summary.text:
**Handling conditional payload typing**

I'm working through how to properly type an email payload that requires either html or text content. The challenge is narrowing the union type correctly so TypeScript accepts the conditional branches without errors. I'm planning to add explicit runtime checks and use `satisfies` to ensure the payload matches the expected email options, throwing if neither html nor text is provided. This way, I can keep the input type flexible while preventing type errors during payload construction.

payload.name: apply_patch

payload.output: {"output":"Success. Updated the following files:\nM src/lib/actions/email.ts\n","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

payload.message:
Cambie la construccion del payload para cumplir el union de `CreateEmailOptions`: ahora se arma en ramas donde se garantiza `html` o `text`, y si no hay contenido lanza error.

Cambios
- `src/lib/actions/email.ts` crea `payload` en dos ramas (`html` o `text`) y evita `html/text` indefinidos.

Si quieres, tambien puedo reforzar el tipo de `input` para exigir `html` o `text` en el callsite.
